results.title: Tales of the riverbank: morning mist
results.creator_credit: Paul Sutherland, McGraw-Hill Films and Riverbank Productions
results.brief_description: Hammy awakens to find that the river outside his house looks as though it were on fire. He decides to investigate, and heads upstream in a motor boat. He is soon engulfed in a white cloud, but the sun breaks through - it is the morning mist. Lost in a strange cave, Hammy is eventually rescued by Roddy and Guinea Pig.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Sutherland, McGraw-Hill Films and Riverbank Productions

results.title: Taleb and his lamb: a Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility.
results.creator_credit: Ami Amitai, Amitai Film Productions and Barr Films
results.brief_description: This film is subtitled, “A Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility. “The tale is about Taleb, a shepherd’s son, who has a pet lamb from his father’s flock. Taleb steals the lamb, after it is taken to the market to be sold for slaughter, and hides in the desert with it. The angry father finds them, but how the story ends is left up to the viewer to decide.
results.title_for_label: Taleb and his lamb: a Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ami Amitai, Amitai Film Productions and Barr Films

results.title: Taking their place
results.creator_credit: Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Government film about the rehabilitation and re-employment of the physically handicapped in the “normal workforce”. Follows Noel Simpson, a paraplegic, through this process.

results.title: Taking our bodies back
results.brief_description: This film documents a growing movement of women to regain control of their bodies, and it shows women becoming aware of their rights in dealing with the medical industry. The film explores critical areas of the women’s health movement, including self-help and self-examination; giving birth at home; breast cancer and abortion.

results.title: Taking it in stride: positive approaches to stress management
results.brief_description: Life has a way of getting more and more hectic as time goes by. For many of us, it is a major accomplishment to simply get through the day. This film offers hope by going beyond an analysis of the ‘Stress Response’ and its link to disease. It focuses on solutions, skills for coping with stress.

results.title: Taking care of your pets
results.brief_description: An appeal to all animal lovers to assist with the humane work of caring for our sick and injured animal population. Illustrates the medical attention provided at the Dogs’ Home and Hospital; the work of ambulances treating animals injured by modern high-speed traffic; the work of the dog catchers collecting stray animals from the streets and the subsequent care of these at the Dogs’ Home.

results.title: Taking a time study
results.creator_credit: Stephen Clarkson, Gerald Cookson and Kinocraft
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic techniques for taking a time study. The method illustrated has been agreed upon by the representatives of management and trade unions and is recommended as sound basic training for trainee work study officers. Valuable for showing to people whose work is likely to be the subject of work measurement.

results.title: Taken
results.creator_credit: Hayley Cloake, Libby Porter, Cinemedia, Elisabeth Anne Green and XY2
results.brief_description: When Sophie finds a message on her answering machine from recently separated husband, Michael, she strikes an unlikely alliance with his ‘errand boy’, Jason. Cast includes Kerry Armstrong, Samuel Johnston and David Michod.

results.title: Take your choice
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Presented by Heinz, this documentary suggests that boredom and juvenile delinquency can be alleviated by introducing young adults to the organised activities of the Boy Scouts and Girl Guides Associations. Shows a range of activities available including camping, orienteering, water sports and rock climbing. Also shows the various volunteer programs that these associations support.
